amendment.description: Amendment makes technical changes that affect the neighborhood teacher program, the risk sharing demonstration program, and the rural housing section of the bill; expands housing assistance for native Hawaiians by extending to them the same types of Federal housing programs available to Native Americans and to Alaska natives; adopts changes to the manufactured housing title to clarify the HUD Secretary's authority over appointments to the consensus committee; makes changes in the Homeownership Zone Grant program; extends homeownership counseling statutes through September 30, 2005; includes a sense of Congress that the HUD Secretary should consult with other agencies to make additional properties available for law enforcement officers, teachers, and fire fighters; and permits pre-kindergarten teachers to be eligible under section 203 for reduced down payment for loans for teachers and uniformed municipal employees, consistent with similar other provisions in the bill.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 1 printed in House Report 106-562. This manager's amendment made in order by the rule, makes sundry improvements, changes and clarifications to the bill.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Lazio amendment (A001) Agreed to by voice vote.
